title: 'Ready To Work With India': China Ahead Of Crucial Meeting With Ajit Doval - News18
summary:
China Ready to Collaborate with India as Doval-Wang Meeting Begins

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: News18

China has expressed its readiness to work with India to enhance bilateral relations ahead of a crucial meeting between National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Beijing.

  • The talks aim to restore relations following the October 21 agreement to disengage troops in eastern Ladakh.
  • This meeting marks the first high-level talks between India and China since December 2019.
  • Focus areas include the India-China boundary question and strengthening mutual trust through dialogue.
  • China is committed to respect India's core interests and bring relations back to stable development.
“China is ready to work with India to implement the important common understandings between the leaders of China and India.” - Lin Jian, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson

This meeting underscores the ongoing diplomatic efforts to normalize ties after years of tensions, particularly following the Galwan Valley clash in 2020.
newTitle: China Ready to Collaborate with India as Doval-Wang Meeting Begins

Priyanka Gandhi on Yogi Adityanath's jibe at her Palestine bag: ‘Throwing youths into…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi Responds to Yogi Adityanath's Comments on Her Palestine Bag

Publication Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has reacted to Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's remarks regarding her bag featuring the term 'Palestine'. She criticized the state's policy of sending youths to Israel for work in conflict zones, calling it shameful.

  • Priyanka Gandhi carried a 'Palestine' bag to Parliament, which attracted criticism from BJP leaders.
  • Yogi Adityanath stated that over 5,600 youths from UP have gone to Israel for employment, emphasizing their safety and salaries.
  • Priyanka labeled sending youths into a war zone for jobs as a disgrace and highlighted the unemployment issues in UP.
  • She spoke out against the exploitation of these youths and their families, who live in constant fear.
"Throwing our youths into the war zone for employment is not something to pat on the back but a matter of shame." - Priyanka Gandhi

This exchange underscores ongoing tensions between political leaders regarding employment strategies and international relations.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Responds to Yogi Adityanath's Comments on Her Palestine Bag

  • Ajit Doval and Wang Yi met to discuss enhancing bilateral ties between India and China.
  • Beijing has shown a readiness to cooperate with India on various fronts.

title: Delhi AQI: Air quality at ‘severe-plus’ category in some areas amid GRAP curbs - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi AQI: Air quality at ‘severe-plus’ category in some areas amid GRAP curbs

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi faced dangerously high levels of air pollution with the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) reaching over 440, classifying the air quality as ‘severe’. The city implemented Stage 4 restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) to combat the pollution crisis.

  • Overall AQI recorded at 442 at 7 am on December 18, 2024.
  • Some monitoring stations reported AQI levels in the ‘severe-plus’ category beyond 450.
  • AQI levels at worst stations: Nehru Nagar (480), Alipur (471), Anand Vihar (481).
  • Stage 4 restrictions include a ban on construction activities and non-essential vehicle entry into Delhi.
  • Experts attribute rising pollution to low wind speeds and various local factors.
“Breathing Delhi's polluted air is equivalent to smoking approximately 10 cigarettes a day.”

The ongoing air quality crisis necessitates urgent action and compliance with GRAP restrictions to protect public health.
newTitle: Delhi Air Quality Reaches 'Severe-Plus' Levels Amid Pollution Restrictions

title: Donald Trump threatens ‘reciprocal’ tax on India: ‘If India charges us 100%…’ | Today News - Mint
‘Ready to work with India’, says China ahead of key Doval-Wang talks | What's on agenda - Hindustan Times
summary:
China Ready to Collaborate with India Before Key Doval-Wang Talks

Date: Dec 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

China is prepared to work with India to restore bilateral relations ahead of upcoming talks between India's National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, marking the first meeting of Special Representatives in five years.

  • First Doval-Wang meeting since December 2019 will take place in Beijing.
  • China's foreign ministry emphasizes readiness to strengthen mutual trust and settle differences.
  • The two leaders will discuss border management and explore solutions to the boundary dispute.
  • Recent agreements were reached regarding patrolling arrangements along the Line of Actual Control.
  • The military standoff, starting in May 2020, has strained India-China relations.
“China is ready to work with India to implement the important common understandings between our leaders... and bring bilateral relations back to the track of stable and healthy development as soon as possible.”

This structured dialogue represents a critical step in rebuilding relationships strained by previous military clashes and ongoing tensions along the Indo-China border.
newTitle: China Ready to Collaborate with India Before Key Doval-Wang Talks

title: Bangladesh makes another SHOCKING statement, says 'India was nothing...' - India.com
Congress accuses Amit Shah of insulting Ambedkar in Parliament speech, demands apology - Hindustan Times
summary:
Congress Demands Apology from Amit Shah for Comments on Ambedkar

Date: Dec 18, 2024
Source: HT News Desk

The Congress party criticized Amit Shah for his comments regarding BR Ambedkar during a Rajya Sabha address, demanding an apology from the Home Minister.

  • Amit Shah accused Congress of using Ambedkar's name as a political tool.
  • Shah stated that citing Ambedkar had become a 'fashion' for Congress.
  • Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, condemned Shah's remarks.
  • Kharge emphasized that Ambedkar is revered as a messiah for marginalized communities.
  • Jairam Ramesh labeled Shah's comments as disgusting and reflective of BJP's deep-seated animosity towards Ambedkar.
“For crores of people like me, Babasaheb Ambedkar is no less than God.” - Mallikarjun Kharge

In light of Shah's comments, the Congress party continues to assert the importance of Ambedkar's legacy and the need for respect towards it.
newTitle: Congress Demands Apology from Amit Shah for Comments on Ambedkar

title: Donald Trump's message to India over high tariffs: 'They tax us, we tax them' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Trump's Stance on High Tariffs: A Call for Reciprocity with India

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Donald Trump, in a recent statement, made it clear that fairness in trade is crucial, emphasizing that the United States will impose reciprocal tariffs on countries like India that impose high tariffs on American goods.

  • Trump plans to implement tariffs equivalent to those charged by other nations on US exports.
  • He expressed that if India charges a 100% tariff on US products, the US will respond similarly.
  • His comments were aimed at highlighting inequities in trade practices between the US and countries like India and Brazil.
“Reciprocal. If they tax us, we tax them the same amount,” Trump stated.

In conclusion, Trump's administration is likely to continue focusing on ensuring equitable trade practices and considering reciprocity in tariff policies, which may shape future US-India trade relations.
newTitle: Trump's Stance on High Tariffs: A Call for Reciprocity with India

title: Why bring religion into the armed forces, ex-servicemen organisation poses questions to CDS and chiefs - The Hindu
summary:
Veterans Question Religious Symbols in Armed Forces After Painting Removal

Published on: December 18, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

Veterans have expressed concerns over the introduction of religious themes in military symbols following the controversial removal of a historic painting commemorating the 1971 India-Pakistan war from the Army chief's lounge.

  • Brigadier Inder Mohan Singh from the IESL questioned the relevance of introducing religion in the armed forces.
  • The painting was replaced with a new artwork that included cultural symbols like Garuda and Krishna's chariot.
  • Mohan emphasized that the removal was seen as an attack on historical military heritage.
  • The new painting, 'Karam Kshetra - Field of Deeds', features modern military equipment along with historically significant imagery.
  • Mohan called to gift the historical painting to the IESL for preservation.
“To finish photos which reflect history is an unpardonable act.” – Brigadier Inder Mohan Singh

The discussion continues as veterans seek clarity on how these changes reflect the values and traditions of the armed forces.
newTitle: Veterans Question Religious Symbols in Armed Forces After Painting Removal

title: Rs 14,000 crore returned to banks from Mallya assets sales: FM Nirmala Sitharaman - The Times of India
summary:
Rs 14,000 crore returned to banks from Mallya assets sales: FM Nirmala Sitharaman

Publication Date & Source: Times of India

In a significant financial development, Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that ₹14,000 crore has been returned to banks through the sale of assets linked to businessman Vijay Mallya. This repayment represents a crucial step in addressing the financial misconduct associated with Mallya's dealings.

  • The amount recovered is part of the ongoing efforts to compensate banks affected by Mallya's business failures.
  • These asset sales have helped in mitigating some of the financial losses incurred.
  • The government remains committed to bolstering financial accountability and transparency.
“The recovery of ₹14,000 crore is a testament to our resolve against financial wrongdoing,” said Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

The recovery of these funds marks a notable achievement in the Indian government's efforts to combat financial corruption and restore asset value to banks.
newTitle: Rs 14,000 crore returned to banks from Mallya assets sales: FM Nirmala Sitharaman

title: Delhi remains India’s most polluted city for second day in a row; GRAP Stage IV restrictions kick in - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi remains India’s most polluted city for second day in a row; GRAP Stage IV restrictions kick in

Published: December 18, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

Delhi's air quality has deteriorated significantly, making it the most polluted city in India for two consecutive days. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) has issued warnings about the health impacts of this severe pollution.

  • Delhi's air quality index (AQI) reached severe levels, recording a measure of 401 at 10 p.m. on December 6, 2024.
  • The AQI is on a scale of 0-500, where 401-450 is 'severe'.
  • Pollution levels are attributed to stubble burning, vehicular emissions, and stagnant weather conditions.
  • Stage IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) has been implemented, limiting construction activities and older vehicles.
  • Pollution is expected to stay high with PM2.5 levels at 251.5 micrograms per cubic meter, exceeding WHO's safe limit.
“Severe-level air pollution affects healthy people and seriously impacts those with existing diseases.” - CPCB

The ongoing pollution crisis in Delhi is prompting renewed calls for action and greater awareness of air quality issues.
newTitle: Delhi Most Polluted City Again; GRAP Stage IV Restrictions Imposed

title: 'One Nation, One Election' bill introduced in Lok Sabha, Opposition demands withdrawal - The New Indian Express
summary:
One Nation, One Election Bill Introduced Amidst Opposition Demands for Withdrawal

Date: 17 Dec 2024 | Source: The New Indian Express

Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal introduced the 'One Nation, One Election' bill, seeking to hold simultaneous Lok Sabha and state assembly elections, facing strong opposition urging its withdrawal.

  • Introduction of the Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024, and the Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2024.
  • First-time use of electronic voting in the Lok Sabha.
  • 269 members in favor and 198 against during the introduction of the bills.
  • Opposition parties claim the bills are anti-democratic and violate the Constitution.
  • Support from NDA allies, but uncertainty from fence-sitters.
“Beyond the seventh schedule of the Constitution is the basic structured doctrine and that basic structure doctrine spells out that there are certain features of the Indian Constitution which are beyond the amending power of this House also.” - Congress MP Manish Tewari

The introduction of the ONOE bills marks a significant step towards electoral reform, yet faces a complex path filled with political contention and opposition scrutiny.
newTitle: One Nation, One Election Bill Introduced Amidst Opposition Demands for Withdrawal

title: Chennai Weather: Heavy Rain Likely In Chennai For 2 Days, Orange Alert In 4 TN Districts - News18
summary:
Chennai Weather: Heavy Rain Likely In Chennai For 2 Days, Orange Alert In 4 TN Districts

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: News18

The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a weather warning for Chennai due to a low-pressure area in the Bay of Bengal. The effects are expected to last for several days.

  • A low-pressure area has formed over the South Bay of Bengal.
  • An orange alert has been issued for very heavy rainfall in several districts.
  • Heavy rain is expected in Chennai and surrounding areas on December 17 and 18.
  • The rain is likely to intensify on December 19 and continue until December 20.
  • Chennai, Chengalpattu, Tiruvallur, and Puducherry are among the districts affected.
"The Meteorological Department warns of very heavy rainfall on Tuesday and expects rainfall to begin around 1 pm, intensifying throughout the day."

This weather condition is significant for the affected areas, with warnings issued to prepare for potential heavy rainfall impacts.
newTitle: Chennai Weather Forecast: Heavy Rain and Orange Alert for Tamil Nadu

title: GRAP-4: Delhi-NCR Schools To Go Hybrid For All Classes Except Grades 10, 12 - News18
summary:
GRAP-4: Delhi-NCR Schools To Go Hybrid For All Classes Except Grades 10, 12

Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: News18

Schools in Delhi-NCR will shift to hybrid classes, combining online and physical attendance for most grades, due to severe air quality issues.

  • Classes VI to IX and XI will now be hybrid as part of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) Stage 4.
  • Decision triggered by alarming Air Quality Index levels surpassing 400.
  • Schools in districts like Gurugram, Faridabad, and Ghaziabad are included in this mandate.
  • Despite guidelines, some Noida schools are reportedly not following the hybrid directive and are still conducting in-person classes.
“Noida schools are very much offline; they have not declared hybrid classes.” - Ayesha Singh, Parent

The hybrid model aims to ensure safety and continuity of education amid worsening air quality in the region.
newTitle: Delhi-NCR Schools Transition to Hybrid Learning Mode for Most Classes

summary:
Opposition highlights lack of numbers as govt introduces 'One Nation, One Election' bill in Lok Sabha

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The article discusses the introduction of the 'One Nation, One Election' bill in Lok Sabha and the opposition's criticism regarding insufficient numbers supporting the initiative.

  • The government has introduced a bill aiming to synchronize elections across the country.
  • Opposition parties express concerns over the lack of detailed data backing the proposal.
  • Experts warn that such a shift could alter the federal electoral structure of India.
  • The success of the bill heavily relies on the clarity and accuracy of the proposed reforms.

title: Cold wave continues to sweep North India, Punjab's Faridkot at minimum temperature of zero degree - Hindustan Times
summary:
Cold Wave Affects Northern India, Faridkot Hits Zero Degrees

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A severe cold wave continues to impact many areas of northern and eastern India, with Faridkot recording a minimum temperature of zero degrees Celsius.

  • Minimum temperatures have plunged in Jammu and Kashmir, Jharkhand, Haryana, and Punjab.
  • The national capital, Delhi, registered a minimum temperature of 5.9 degrees Celsius, which is below normal.
  • Other affected regions include Amritsar (2.6 degrees), Ludhiana (4.8 degrees), and Patiala (4.8 degrees).
  • Karnal recorded a low of 4.6 degrees Celsius in Haryana.
  • Rajasthan is experiencing extremely cold conditions with Karauli seeing a minimum of 1.3 degrees Celsius.
  • In Kashmir, Konibal recorded the coldest temperature at minus 8.5 degrees Celsius.
“Water supply lines in several parts of the Valley are frozen due to the cold,” officials stated.

The cold wave is expected to continue, with the Indian Meteorological Department predicting a slight rise in temperatures in East India while maintaining dry weather conditions until December 26.
newTitle: Cold Wave Affects Northern India, Faridkot Hits Zero Degrees

title: Centre mulls holding NEET-UG exam in online mode - The Hindu
summary:
Centre mulls holding NEET-UG exam in online mode

Published on: December 17, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The Union government is exploring the possibility of transitioning the National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test (NEET-UG) from offline to online mode, as announced by Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan. A decision is expected soon after two rounds of discussions with the Health Ministry.

  • The NEET-UG is currently administered in offline mode, with over 24 lakh students appearing in 2024.
  • A focus on reforms for the NEET examination is planned for implementation in 2025.
  • Changes in methodology and protocols for NEET will be announced shortly.
“The NTA is ready to undertake the exercise,” Mr. Pradhan stated.

In addition, the Minister announced a reduction in prices of NCERT textbooks starting next year, with efforts to increase production capacity for textbooks aimed at ensuring affordability for parents.
newTitle: Centre Considers Online NEET-UG Exam Format

title: Starlink Device Allegedly Used By Meitei Insurgent Group Seized In Manipur: Sources - NDTV
Congress considered Constitution private fiefdom of one family, says Amit Shah - The Hindu
summary:
Amit Shah Criticizes Congress Over Constitutional Amendments

Date: December 17, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The ongoing debate on the Constitution saw Union Home Minister Amit Shah accuse Congress of manipulating constitutional provisions for political gain, while defending the BJP's amendments as aimed at empowering citizens.

  • Shah labeled Congress as "anti-reservation" and claimed their push for increasing the reservation ceiling aims to introduce religion-based reservations.
  • He noted Congress's history of amendments, stating they made 77 changes during their rule compared to 22 by the BJP.
  • The discussion was part of a 31-hour debate commemorating 75 years of the Indian Constitution.
  • Shah reaffirmed the BJP's stance against religion-based reservations and emphasized the secular nature of the Indian Constitution.
“The Congress considered the Constitution as private fiefdom of one family and deceived Parliament.” - Amit Shah

This debate highlights the ongoing political contention over constitutional amendments in India, as parties clash over their historical actions and principles.
newTitle: Amit Shah Criticizes Congress Over Constitutional Amendments

title: One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced In Lok Sabha; 269 Members Vote In Favour, 198 Oppose - News18
summary:
One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced In Lok Sabha; 269 Members Vote In Favour, 198 Oppose

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: News18

Two bills enabling simultaneous elections were introduced in the Lok Sabha after a heated debate, with 269 votes in favor and 198 against.

  • The Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024 and The Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2024 were formally introduced.
  • The bills propose simultaneous elections for both Lok Sabha and state assemblies.
  • The bills will be sent to a Joint Parliamentary Committee for detailed discussions.
  • Opposition claims the bills attack the federal structure.
  • The electronic voting system was used for the first time in the new Parliament House.
“The electors have the right to elect the government for five years, and this right cannot be curtailed with simultaneous elections.” - DMK MP TR Baalu

In conclusion, the introduction of these bills has sparked considerable debate regarding their impact on India’s federal structure.
newTitle: One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced In Lok Sabha; 269 Members Vote In Favour, 198 Oppose

title: Amit Shah slams Congress for 'fraud' on Constitution amendments, calls it their 'private fiefdom' - The Times of India
summary:

Publication Date: Date Not Provided

Source: Source Not Provided

Amit Shah has condemned the Congress party for accusations of 'fraud' related to constitutional amendments, labeling it a 'private fiefdom' of the party.

  • Amit Shah expressed concerns over Congress's handling of constitutional matters.
  • He emphasized the necessity of upholding democratic values.
  • The term 'private fiefdom' suggests monopoly over political processes by Congress.
'The Congress party treats the constitution as their private asset.'

Shah's statements are a part of ongoing political debates regarding constitutional reform in India.
